intro: Platanthera solstitialis var. brachyglossa, commonly known as the short-lipped lady's tresses, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and a distinctive inflorescence of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. It has a rhizomatous root system and produces small, oval-shaped pseudobulbs. The species is notable for its specialized pollination mechanism involving specific insect species.
